net.amoebaman.utils
Class CommandController

java.lang.Object
  net.amoebaman.utils.CommandController
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor
public class CommandController
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor

Contains interfaces and methods for allowing other plugins to handle commands via annotated methods, much the same way that Bukkit currently handles events.

Author:
AmoebaMan

Nested Class Summary
static interface CommandController.CommandHandler
          An annotation interface that may be attached to a method to designate it as a command handler.
 
Method Summary
 boolean onCommand(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, org.bukkit.command.Command command, java.lang.String label, java.lang.String[] args)
          This is the method that "officially" processes commands, but in reality it will always delegate responsibility to the handlers and methods assigned to the command or subcommand Beyond checking permissions, checking player/console sending, and invoking handlers and methods, this method does not actually act on the commands
static void registerCommands(java.lang.Object handler)
          Registers all command handlers in a class, matching them with their corresponding commands registered to the specified plugin.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

registerCommands

public static void registerCommands(java.lang.Object handler)
Registers all command handlers in a class, matching them with their corresponding commands registered to the specified plugin.

Parameters:
plugin - The plugin whose commands will be considered for registration
handler - An instance of the class whose methods will be considered for registration

onCommand

public boolean onCommand(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                         org.bukkit.command.Command command,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         java.lang.String[] args)
This is the method that "officially" processes commands, but in reality it will always delegate responsibility to the handlers and methods assigned to the command or subcommand Beyond checking permissions, checking player/console sending, and invoking handlers and methods, this method does not actually act on the commands

Specified by:
onCommand in interface org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor
